original: Karl Fridolf Erik, redaktör, kapten, Vadstena, f. 25/1/93 i Vadstena av redaktör Erik W. o. Frida Dahlberg. G. 20 m. Hedvig Wetter-blad. Barn: Hedvig f. 21, Gunnar 23, Åke 26, Bertil 27. — Elev v. Vadstena o. Linköp. lärov., stud:ex. 12, res :-oiff :ex. 15. Kapten i Livgren :reg. res. 30. Medarb. i Karlskrona-Tidn. 16, i Sv. notisbyrån 17, i Östgöta-Bladet 18- 19, redaktör o. utg. av Östgöta-Bladet fr. 19, utg. av l’antm:tidn. Jordbrukaren |fr. 26. Landstingsman (h) fr. 35, kd. av ’stadsfullm. sed. 27, ordf. fr. 41. Ordf. i fören. Birgittahemmet, ordf. i Vadstena högerfören. o. i luftsk:-fören., Vätterns seglarförb., Publ :k}. östra krets, led. av Publ :kl. styr. Sign.: F. W., -lin. , Gunnar Vitalis, redaktör, tecknare, Göteborg, f. 7/3/96 i Gbg av tulltj :man Anders W. o. Anna Lena Aronsdtr. G. m. journ. Ingeborg Lönn-qvist. — Skådesp. h. Hj. Selander 17- 20. Stud. på Valand samt i Paris o. Londou. Medarb. i Gbgs Alorgonpost 20-21, red. o. tecknare i Gbgs-Tidn. sed. 21. Init:tag. t. Gbgs ikonstnärskl. 33 o. dess sekr., medl. av Sv. journ :-fören. o. Publ:kl Utställt på bl. a. Humoristernas salong i Sthlm 30, i Gbg 3’1, Int. humoristutställn. i Sthkn 3i2, sep :utst. i Sthlm 41, Gbg 46. Repr. i Gbgs mus. Skr.: Gbgs-mysterier, teckn. o. kåserier 25 (tills. m. H. Här-neman 29, 30, 31 o. 34), Wallins gubbar 41. Sign.: Gev^e.
translated: Karl Fridolf Erik, editor, captain, Vadstena, b. 25/1/93 in Vadstena to editor Erik W. and Frida Dahlberg. Married on 20, May Hedvig Wetter-blad. Children: Hedvig b. 21, Gunnar b. 23, Åke b. 26, Bertil b. 27. Attended schools in Vadstena and Linköping, high school diploma in 1912, university entrance exams in 1915. Captain in the Livgrenadier Regiment, reserve officer from 1930. Worked for Karlskrona-Tidningen in 1916, Swedish News Agency in 1917, Östgöta-Bladet from 1918 to 1919, editor and publisher of Östgöta-Bladet from 1919, publisher of Lantmannen from 1926. Member of the County Council (right-wing) from 1935, member of the City Council since 1927, chairman since 1941. Chairman of the Birgittahemmet association, chairman of the Vadstena Right Association, chairman of the aviation association, chairman of the Vättern Sailing Association, member of the Public Schools Eastern District Board. Signed as F. W., Gunnar Vitalis, editor, illustrator, Gothenburg, b. 7/3/96 in Gothenburg to customs officer Anders W. and Anna Lena Aronsdtr. Married to journalist Ingeborg Lönnqvist. Actor at Hj. Selander Theater 17-20. Studied at Valand and in Paris and London. Worked for Göteborgs Morgonpost from 1920 to 1921, editor and illustrator for Göteborgs-Tidningen since 1921. Co-founder and secretary of the Gothenburg Artists' Club in 1933, member of the Swedish Journalist Association and the Publicist Club. Exhibited at Humoristernas Salong in Stockholm in 1930, in Gothenburg in 1931, International Humorist Exhibition in Stockholm in 1932, separate exhibitions in Stockholm in 1941 and Gothenburg in 1946. Represented in Gothenburg Museum. Writings: Göteborg Mysteries, illustrations and essays in 1925 (co-authored with H. Härneman in 1929, 1930, 1931, and 1934), Wallin's Old Men in 1941. Signed as Gev^e.
